title: Continuous generation of an ultracold atomic beam using crossed moving optical lattices

reference.volume-title: Optical Dipole Traps for Neutral Atoms
reference.author: R. Grimm

abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
               <jats:p>We have demonstrated the continuous outcoupling of ultracold <jats:sup>88</jats:sup>Sr atoms using a moving optical lattice. While Sr atoms are Zeeman-slowed and magneto-optically trapped on the <jats:sup>1</jats:sup>S<jats:sub>0</jats:sub>–<jats:sup>1</jats:sup>P<jats:sub>1</jats:sub> transition, the atoms relaxed to the 5s5p <jats:sup>3</jats:sup>P<jats:sub>2</jats:sub> metastable state are magnetically trapped and Doppler cooled on the 5s5p <jats:sup>3</jats:sup>P<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>–5s4d <jats:sup>3</jats:sup>D<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> transition at 2.92 <jats:italic>μ</jats:italic>m. By optically pumping the atoms to the 5s5p <jats:sup>3</jats:sup>P<jats:sub>0</jats:sub> state, we outcouple the atoms by a moving optical lattice. Such a continuous atomic source enables superradiant lasers and the zero-dead-time operation of atom interferometers and optical lattice clocks.</jats:p>
title: Continuous outcoupling of ultracold strontium atoms combining three different traps

assertion.name: Ethics

assertion.value: The study was conducted according to the guidelines of the Declaration of Helsinki and approved by the Health Research Ethics Committee of Federal Medical Centre (FMC), Owerri Imo State, Nigeria (Under the Chairmanship of Dr. I.I. Ike, MBBS, FMCPAED) dated February 25th May 2022 under the Chairmanship of Dr. I.I. Ike (FMC/OW/HREC/ Vol.11/048). This study ensured the principle of anonymity and confidentiality. Informed consent was obtained from all the respondents involved in the study.
